```{r, include = F}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(cache = F, comment = "")
library(flipbookr)
```

`r chunk_reveal("dbi", break_type = "user")`

```{r dbi, include=FALSE}
library(DBI)

# Create an ephemeral in-memory RSQLite database
con <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), 
                 dbname = ":memory:")
dbListTables(con) #BREAK

dbWriteTable(con, "mtcars", mtcars)

library(gapminder)
dbWriteTable(con, "gapminder", gapminder)
dbListTables(con) #BREAK

dbWriteTable(con, "mytibble", 
             tibble::tibble(
               country = c("Germany", "Chile"), 
               y = c(1,2)
               ))
dbListTables(con) #BREAK

dbListFields(con, "mtcars") #BREAK
dbReadTable(con, "mtcars") -> #BREAK
  my_table #BREAK

# You can fetch all results:
dbSendQuery(
  con, 
  "SELECT * FROM mtcars WHERE cyl = 4") -> #BREAK
query #BREAK

dbFetch(query) -> #BREAK
  mtcars_subset #BREAK
dbClearResult(query) #BREAK

# Or a chunk at a time
dbSendQuery(
  con, 
  "SELECT * FROM mtcars WHERE cyl = 4") -> #BREAK
res #BREAK

# I dont really understand this part
while(!dbHasCompleted(res)){
  chunk <- dbFetch(res, n = 5)
  print(nrow(chunk))
} #BREAK

dbClearResult(res)
```
